<JD_START>
Job Title: Auto Collision Manager - BodyWerks Collision Center

Location: Knoxville, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
10580 Parkside Dr, Knoxville, TN 37922

AUTOMOTIVE COLLISION CENTER MANAGER

Industry-leading Pay & Great Benefits! Brand-New, State-of-the-Art Facility!

5+ years of Body Shop/Collision Management Experience Required

Are you ready to drive your career to new heights? Knoxville Motor Company Bodywerks is thrilled to offer a rare opportunity for a skilled and driven individual to become our next Collision Director at our groundbreaking Mercedes Benz Evolution - Sherwin Williams AMG themed shop. 

BodyWerks Collision Center is part of the family-owned Furrow Automotive Group which also includes Infiniti Chattanooga, Porsche Chattanooga, Mercedes-Benz of Knoxville, and Land Rover Knoxville/Chattanooga. We’re not just an ordinary collision center - we're Elite Certified specialists in Mercedes Benz, Commercial van, Volvo, and soon-to-be Land Rover repairs. Our commitment to excellence is unmatched, delivering top-tier customer service and craftsmanship.

Join us in revolutionizing the collision repair industry. Apply now and become part of our dynamic team at Knoxville Motor Company Bodywerks!

We offer:

Industry-leading, competitive salary commensurate with experience and expertise Full-time PositionMedical, Dental, Vision, and Disability InsuranceCompany Paid $25,000 Basic Life Insurance401(k) Retirement Plan with Company MatchAccess to cutting-edge facilities and tools to fuel your successBrand New, State-of-the-art FacilityPaid Holidays and Paid Time OffEmployee Discounts on Products & Services & Vehicle Purchase Plans5-Day Work WeekGym Membership DiscountTeladocEmployee Assistance ProgramOpportunity for advancement within the Auto Group


Responsibilities – Collision Manager:

Lead the charge in overseeing all facets of our collision center operationsHarness the talent of our skilled technicians, ensuring smooth workflow and efficiencyCraft and execute strategies to elevate productivity and profitabilityUphold strict adherence to industry standards, safety protocols, and manufacturer directivesCultivate enduring partnerships with insurance providers and suppliersChampion unparalleled customer service, promptly addressing any concerns with finesse


Qualifications/Requirements – Collision Director:

Possess a minimum of 5 years' experience in collision repair managementDeep expertise in Mercedes Benz, Commercial van, Volvo, and Land Rover vehiclesDemonstrate exceptional leadership and team-building prowessExhibit sharp problem-solving skills and decisive decision-making abilitiesProven track record of surpassing targets and objectivesStellar communication and interpersonal finessePlease upload your resume. Completing the online assessment will grant you priority consideration!Applicants must pass pre-employment screeningWe are a Drug-Free WorkplacePassionate and dedicated professional with collision repair management


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
